import Mathlib

/-!
Let X and Y be normed vector spaces over a nontrivial normed field ùïú, and
A : E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] F a bounded linear operator. If A is bijective and E,F are
complete (Banach), then the inverse map A^{-1} : F ‚Üí E is a bounded linear
map.
-/

theorem bounded_inverse_of_bijective {ùïú : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField ùïú]
  {E : Type*} {F : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedAddCommGroup F]
  [NormedSpace ùïú E] [NormedSpace ùïú F] [CompleteSpace E] [CompleteSpace F]
  (A : E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] F) (hA : Function.Bijective (A : E ‚Üí F)) :
  ‚àÉ (B : F ‚ÜíL[ùïú] E), (B.comp A = ContinuousLinearMap.id ùïú E) ‚àß (A.comp B = ContinuousLinearMap.id ùïú F) := by sorry
